targets.rawSql:
select
	count(distinct pr.id) as pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pr.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos"
  and $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})

panels.title: 3.1 Number of New Pull Requests [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAY(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct id) as pr_count
  FROM pull_requests
  JOIN project_mapping pm on pull_requests.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos"
  and $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})
  and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  date_format(time,'%M %Y') as month,
  pr_count as "Pull Request Count"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 3.2 Total Number of New Pull Requests [Each Month]

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
  author_name,
	count(distinct pr.id) as merged_pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pr.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos" and
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})
  and pr.status = 'MERGED'
group by 1
order by 2 desc
limit 20

-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
  count(distinct case when status = 'MERGED' then id else null end)/count(distinct case when status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED') then id else null end) as ratio
from 
	pull_requests pr
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pr.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos" and
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})

panels.title: 4.1 Ratio of Non-merging Pull Requests of All Closed PRs

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
SELECT
  DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAYOFMONTH(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
  count(distinct case when status = 'OPEN' then id else null end) as "PR: Open",
  count(distinct case when status = 'CLOSED' then id else null end) as "PR: Closed without merging",
  count(distinct case when status = 'MERGED' then id else null end) as "PR: Closed and merged"
from 
	pull_requests
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pull_requests.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos" and
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})
  and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
group by 1

-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
	count(distinct pr.id) as merged_pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pr.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos" and
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})
	and pr.status = 'CLOSED'

panels.title: 4.3 Number of Pull Requests Closed without Merging [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
SELECT
  DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAYOFMONTH(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
  count(distinct case when status = 'CLOSED' then id else null end)/count(distinct case when status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED') then id else null end) as ratio
from 
	pull_requests pr
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pr.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos" and
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})
group by 1

panels.title: 4.4 Ratio of Non-merging Pull Requests of All Closed PRs [Each Month]

targets.rawSql:
select
	avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,merged_date)/1440)
from 
	pull_requests pr
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pr.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos" and
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})
	and pr.merged_date is not null

panels.title: 4.5 Mean Time to Merge of Pull Requests in Days [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAY(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,merged_date)/1440) as time_to_merge
  from 
	pull_requests
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pull_requests.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos" and
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})
    and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  date_format(time,'%M %Y') as month,
  time_to_merge as "Time to Merge"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 4.6 Mean Time to Merge of Pull Requests in Days [Each Month]

targets.rawSql:
select
	avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,closed_date)/1440) as time_to_close
from 
	pull_requests pr
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pr.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos" and
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})
	and pr.status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED')

panels.title: 4.7 Mean Time to Close of Pull Requests in Days [Selected Time Range]

targets.rawSql:
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -DAY(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,closed_date)/1440) as time_to_close
  from 
	pull_requests
	JOIN project_mapping pm on pull_requests.base_repo_id = pm.row_id
where pm.`table` = "repos" and
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and pm.project_name in (${project_id})
    and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED')
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  date_format(time,'%M %Y') as month,
  time_to_close as "Time to Close"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 4.8 Mean Time to Close of Pull Requests in Days [Each Month]

panels.description: Number of workflow runs executed in the selected time range

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  count(distinct id)
FROM 
  cicd_pipelines
  JOIN project_mapping pm on cicd_pipelines.cicd_scope_id = pm.row_id
WHERE pm.`table` = "cicd_scopes" and
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  AND pm.project_name IN (${project_id})
  and result = 'SUCCESS'
  and id like "%github%"
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)

panels.title: 5.1 Total Number of Successful workflow runs [Selected Time Range]

panels.description: Number of successful workflow runs / Number of total workflow runs

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  1.0 * count(case when result = 'SUCCESS' then id else null end)/count(distinct id)
FROM 
  cicd_pipelines
  JOIN project_mapping pm on cicd_pipelines.cicd_scope_id = pm.row_id
WHERE pm.`table` = "cicd_scopes" and
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  AND pm.project_name IN (${project_id})
  and id like "%github%"
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)

panels.title: 5.2 Mean Workflow Runs Success Rate

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  result,
  count(distinct id) as build_count
FROM 
  cicd_pipelines
  JOIN project_mapping pm on cicd_pipelines.cicd_scope_id = pm.row_id
WHERE pm.`table` = "cicd_scopes" and
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  AND pm.project_name IN (${project_id})
  and id like "%github%"
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 desc

panels.description: Number of successful workflow runs / Number of total workflow runs

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  avg(duration_sec/60) as duration_in_minutes
FROM 
  cicd_pipelines
  JOIN project_mapping pm on cicd_pipelines.cicd_scope_id = pm.row_id
WHERE pm.`table` = "cicd_scopes" and
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  AND pm.project_name IN (${project_id})
  and id like "%github%"
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)

panels.title: 5.4 Mean Workflow Runs Duration in Minutes

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  DATE_ADD(date(finished_date), INTERVAL -DAYOFMONTH(date(finished_date))+1 DAY) as time,
  count(distinct case when result = 'SUCCESS' then id else null end) as successful_workflow_run_count,
  count(distinct case when result != 'SUCCESS' then id else null end) as failed_workflow_run_count
FROM 
  cicd_pipelines
  JOIN project_mapping pm on cicd_pipelines.cicd_scope_id = pm.row_id
WHERE pm.`table` = "cicd_scopes" and
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  AND pm.project_name IN (${project_id})
  and id like "%github%"
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
GROUP BY 1

panels.title: 5.3.1 Number of Successful and Failed workflow runs [Each Month]
